intro: Hypolaena exsulca, commonly known as the slender hypolaena, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes a wide variety of orchids. The plant is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
